newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: PLATINUM OFF SHARPLY IN EUROPE, STILL VOLATILE.
newsitem.headline: PLATINUM OFF SHARPLY IN EUROPE, STILL VOLATILE.

text.p: Gold was slightly lower in early Europe but little changed overall versus Wednesday, while platinum remained volatile.
Gold was quoted at $318.65/$319.15 an ounce compared with $319.50/$320.00 at the close in London on Wednesday. Silver was also lower at $4.34/$4.36 versus $4.36/$4.38.
Trade in both was seen quiet and in a range.
Platinum, meanwhile, was off sharply at $419.00/$422.00 compared with $437.50/$440.50 at the London close.
Palladium was also lower at $218.00/$221.00 versus $228.00/$231.00.
Platinum group metal (PGM) futures fell sharply in Tokyo on long liquidation.
One Swiss-based trader said technicals projected a downside target for platinum of $401.00 over the next few days.
But the trader added that uncertainties concerning Russian PGM deliveries could keep PGM prices volatile.
Russia is the world's leading supplier of palladium and also a major platinum supplier.
